alert.note: Alert for Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 8:27PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo County through 915 PM CDT... At 826 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Alamo, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pharr, Weslaco, San Juan, Alamo, Donna, Hidalgo, South McAllen, Edinburg Regional Medical Center, Austin Middle School and South Pharr Elementary School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 C between mile markers 1 and 4. US Highway 281 between mile markers 784 and 804. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
